multipleChoice.stem: What is an example of a cash reconciling item for an item recorded in the general ledger but not yet recorded in the bank statement?

choice.distractor: Interest earned on notes held by the bank

choice.distractor: Interest earned on notes held by the bank

multipleChoice.stem: The 2011 movie Moneyball is an example of drill-down, detailed analytics applied to the sport of _______.

question.title: M 7-6 Appropriate test to compare one population to another (LO 7-3)

internal_category.title: Learning Objective: 7-3 Using the Match() Function to Perform Bank Reconciliations

multipleChoice.stem: The appropriate test to compare one sample to another sample to see if one is greater than another in some way is called a(n) _______.

choice.distractor: two-sample t-test of a difference in means
one-sample t-test of a difference in means
chi-squared test of a difference in means

question.title: M 7-7 Appropriate test to see if independent variables are related to a dependent variable (LO 7-3)

internal_category.title: Learning Objective: 7-3 Using the Match() Function to Perform Bank Reconciliations

multipleChoice.stem: The appropriate test to see if independent variables are related to a dependent variable is called a(n) _______.

choice.distractor: two-sample t-test of a difference in means
one-sample t-test of a difference in means
chi-squared test of a difference in means

multipleChoice.stem: _______ is used to help find vendors that might have a similar address as an employee.

multipleChoice.stem: In fuzzy matching, if an exact match (tolerance = 100%) is required, what is the likely consequence for finding potential matches?

choice.distractor: Good mix between exact and potential matches

multipleChoice.stem: Management accounting uses variance analysis to explain what and why something happened in the cost of producing products. It is done by comparing actual outcomes to expected, or standard, costs. What is the expectation when the price of raw materials unexpectedly increases?
